A centralized platform isn’t inherently bad. Some projects, e.g. exchange tokens, don’t need a permissionless platform, but one that’s fast and scalable. It’s a trade-off.  The problem with Ethereum is that it promises decentralization and scalability and delivers on neither.

I'm well on the way to 20,000 DeFi transactions over two years on Ethereum.  The people trashing Ethereum haven't made a single one.  Who do you think knows the real scoop on Ethereum, someone who uses it every day or someone who never has?

Chaotic & disorganized- yet diverse, resilient & unstoppable.  That’s Ethereum.  Many of you are pioneers, blazing new, untraveled trails. No one’s perfect, but we learn from every disagreement & mistake, becoming stronger for it.  Pay the trolls no mind, and happy holidays! 🎄
